formattedAddress: 102 Suffolk St, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 102 Suffolk St, New York, NY 10002, USA

editorialSummary.text: Japanese cafe offering set breakfasts and lunches, plus coffee, tea, and matcha lattes.

originalText.text: Cute little Japanese cafe! I stopped in at their to go location (the cafe is split into two spaces) and ordered the hojicha latte (roasted green tea) with almond milk and the berry toast. The flavor of the latte was strong and not sweet, which I loved. The toast was fluffy and filling. They use Japanese milk bread, which is quite thick but airy, and I believe the jam was homemade. It was an excellent pairing. The staff were also very friendly! The area with seating looked a little crowded, but I stopped in on a Saturday afternoon. Maybe there's more space during the weekdays.

text.text: Cute little Japanese cafe! I stopped in at their to go location (the cafe is split into two spaces) and ordered the hojicha latte (roasted green tea) with almond milk and the berry toast. The flavor of the latte was strong and not sweet, which I loved. The toast was fluffy and filling. They use Japanese milk bread, which is quite thick but airy, and I believe the jam was homemade. It was an excellent pairing. The staff were also very friendly! The area with seating looked a little crowded, but I stopped in on a Saturday afternoon. Maybe there's more space during the weekdays.

originalText.text: Super cute little cafe with great drinks and food. The place is small so there is usually a wait especially on weekends/brunch time. I loved the matcha au lait with the coffee jelly; very lightly sweetened by the jelly and great texture (ended up ordering 2!). The uni pasta was fresh and not fishy, curry katsu was solid but very spice forward if you like that. The mentai Mayo toast was great! Black sesame was a bit strong and messy to eat but was decent. Overall a super cute date or quick coffee spot.

text.text: Super cute little cafe with great drinks and food. The place is small so there is usually a wait especially on weekends/brunch time. Overall a super cute date or quick coffee spot.

originalText.text:
This morning's visit was a letdown, earning only 3 stars, mainly due to an unpleasant encounter with one of the staff. The incident began awkwardly when I was waiting for a table outside, near a bench with a random bag of trash nearby. Out of nowhere, a staff member, without any polite introduction or even a simple 'excuse me,' bluntly accused me of the trash being mine. His baseless assumption and the lack of courtesy in his approach were off-putting. It would have been more reasonable for him to inquire if I had noticed who left it there, rather than jumping to conclusions.

The same staff member further dampened our experience. Despite us dining efficiently, only 20-25 minutes in, with half our cups still full, he urged us to leave, citing a queue of waiting customers. His tactless remark felt like a needless rush, especially since we were nearly done.

In contrast, the girl who served us was delightful, earning the 20% tip we gladly left, hoping it would solely benefit her. The food was enjoyable too. However, the overall experience was soured by the one staff member's discourteous and presumptuous behavior.

originalText.text: Came here with a friend and we both ordered toasts, honey lemon and raspberry cream cheese. Style over substance - the toasts were both very dry and lacked strong flavours. I was expecting a soft, fluffy, slightly sweet Japanese style milk bread, but the bread seemed to be just a thick cut slice of regular bread. The service was also lackluster. The atmosphere is cozy but because ventilation was not very good because the small space smelled like curry (presumably because there is a curry dish on the menu) and it was a scent that didn’t go well with a cafe experience. I would not return.

text.text: Came here with a friend and we both ordered toasts, honey lemon and raspberry cream cheese. Style over substance - the toasts were both very dry and lacked strong flavours. originalText.text:
The food is as amazing as they look. The people there are so kind and the service is good. The location is very small and bit tight, but we make due. What we ordered :
- black sesame latte kinako latte 10/10, semi sweet, light frothy, and creamy
- black sesame and cream cheese toast 10/10, light and creaminess with a nice half-inch toast that's soft on inside. Must must try
- mentai spaghetti 10/10, savory and light creaminess with suggestive flavors of the Cod roe
- chicken katsu Don 10/10, chicken cutlet over a fried egg blanketing rice under. The flavors are so delicious.

Honestly the whole meal feels so comforting and brought us so mcuh joy. I definitely want to try more on the menu.
